content.question: Advocates of shifting the task of drawing United States House districts from state legislatures to independent commissions are likely to claim which of the following as an advantage of independent commissions?

choices.label: House districts drawn by independent commissions are immune from challenges by the United States Department of Justice.
Independent commissions are more likely to create majority-minority districts where they are appropriate.
Independent commissions significantly reduce the influence of partisan gerrymandering in the redistricting process.
Independent commissions are more likely to create districts where minor parties can be victorious.
Independent commissions are more able to draw legislative districts that comply with the one person, one vote standard.

content.answer: Independent commissions significantly reduce the influence of partisan gerrymandering in the redistricting process.
